intro: Angelica cyclocarpa, commonly known as the cyclocarp angelica, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, compound leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. The roots of Angelica cyclocarpa are known for their strong, spicy scent and have been used in various herbal remedies.
